description:

               Jerry Bruckheimer Films(2007). Length : 124min                 


 While Ben Gates is presenting new information about John Wilkes Booth and    
 the 18 pages missing from Booth&#039;s diary, a man by the name of Mitch          
 Wilkinson stands up and presents a missing page of John Wilkes Booth&#039;s       
 diary. Thomas Gates, Ben&#039;s great-grandfather, is mentioned on the page. It   
 shows that Ben&#039;s great-grandfather was a co-conspirator in Abraham           
 Lincoln&#039;s murder. When doing more research, the conspiracy takes Ben,        
 Abigail Chase, and Riley Poole to Buckingham Palace (which they break        
 into). They discover a plank that has early Native American writing on it.   
 The plank has only one symbol that Patrick Gates can identify. The symbol    
 is Cibola (see-bowl-uh) meaning the City of Gold. In order to define the     
 rest the have to go to Ben&#039;s mother, Patrick&#039;s divorced wife. After 32       
 years it brings back old arguments. After that the other clue is in the      
 President&#039;s desk in the Oval Office in the White House (which Ben and        
 Abigail sneak into) to discover that the clue lies in The President&#039;s Book.  
 But in order to see the book, their choice is either get elected president   
 or kidnap the President of the United States. Which do they choose? It&#039;s     
 obvious. With Wilkinson close on their tail, they find the book in the       
 Library of Congress. The conspiracy then crosses to Mount Rushmore where     
 the clue was on the hills, but (according to the Book) President Calvin      
 Coolidge had the faces carved in so no one can find the City of Gold. When   
 they get there they find out that they must work with Wilkinson since he     
 has some clues of his own. Who will claim Cibola? And will the name of       
 Gates be known as murder?                                                    
                                                                              


                           Happy Hacker Industries                            
This movie should play fine on most DVD/DivX Certified settop
